intro: Mitrasacme katjarranka, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its striking yellow or orange flowers that bloom during the cooler months. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Mitrasacme katjarranka plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
